cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a communication problem involving coding and transmission of information over a noisy channel. This falls under the domain of information theory (cs.IT) and communication (cs.COMM). The paper also discusses the application of the proposed scheme to broadcast channels, which is a subfield of communication. The use of random variables and their properties in the scheme suggests that the paper may also belong to the subfield of statistical inference (cs.SI). The paper also discusses achievable rate regions, which is a topic in the subfield of data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the robustness properties of the proposed scheme, which may fall under the subfield of machine learning (cs.LG).
